metadata.title: CVE-2025-21699 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:gfs2: Truncate address space when flipping GFS2_DIF_JDATA flagTruncate an inode's address space when flipping the GFS2_DIF_JDATA flag:depending on that flag, the pages in the address space will either usebuffer heads or iomap_folio_state structs, and we cannot mix the two.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
